MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001387
Special Investigation Intake Date: May 1, 2024
License #: CI820201063
Licensee Group Organization: Christ Child Society
Licensee Designee: Maria Elaina Lessnau
Chief Administrator: Maria Elaina Lessnau
Agency Name: CHRIST CHILD HOUSE
Agency Address: 15751 JOY RD
DETROIT, MI 48228-2117
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/24/2025
Capacity: 31
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Contact Purpose
Method
5/3/2024 Onsite Special Investigation Initiation; Interview
Inspection
5/3/2024 Documentation Documentation received or sent
5/7/2024 Face to Face Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
1

intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/29/24, a staff member threatened to slap a youth.
Investigation Investigation:
On 05/01/2024 email correspondence occurred with assigned
Foster Care Worker for Youth A. He was advised of allegations
and denied any additional concerns.
All of the following interviews were conducted at Christ Child
House on 05/03/2024 unless otherwise noted.
Interview was held with Clinical Director. She was advised of
initiation of special investigation and allegations were discussed.
Information regarding Youth A was confirmed. She advised that
she received an email from the parent of Youth A who expressed
concern regarding information Youth A told her. Clinical Director
advised that Youth A is currently staffed as a one to one.
Interview was held with Supervisor 1. He confirmed he was on
shift on the date of the reported incident, but was not outside with
youth and other staff. He denied having any concerns with Staff
2.
Interview was held with Residential Coordinator. She has been
employed with the agency for 11 years. She confirmed she was
outside with staff and youth on 4/29/2024. She denied hearing
any threats made by Staff 2 toward Youth A. She further reported
Youth A and Staff 2 have a good relationship and Youth A will
request Staff 2 as his one-to-one staff or when he is struggling.
Residential Coordinator denied any concern with Staff 2 and his
interaction with youth at the facility.
On 05/06/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional information or concerns
regarding the reported allegations.
All of the following interviews were conducted at Christ Child
House on 05/07/2024 unless otherwise noted.
2

Interview held with Staff 1. He reported he was not the one-to-
one staff for Youth A on 4/29/2024. He confirmed he was on shift
this day and was outside with youth and staff. He denied hearing
any staff, including Staff 2, make a threat toward Youth A. He
further denied that Youth A reported to him that he had been
threatened or that he had any concerns with staff interactions
during that day.
Interview held with Staff 2. He reported working for the agency
for 4 years. He denied that he was the one-on-one staff for Youth
A on 4/29/2024. He reported that he has served as his one-to-one
staff because Youth A usually listens to him and they have a good
relationship. Staff 2 was unable to recall all of the youth that were
outside on the day of the incident. He recalled Youth A became
upset because he lost at basketball. Staff 2 stated he was
attempting to redirect Youth A, but Youth A was not responding
well. Shortly after the incident, Youth A was called to the office for
a call with his mother. Staff 2 denied making threats to Youth A or
any other youth at the facility.
Interview held with Staff 3. He confirmed he was not the one-to-
one staff for Youth A on 4/29/24 but was outside with the youth
and other staff. He reported that Youth A was playing basketball
and became upset because he lost. He started using profanity
and staff were trying to redirect him. Staff 3 denied that Youth A
reported to him that he was threatened. Staff 3 further denied
hearing any staff make a threat toward Youth A.
Interview held with Youth B. He reported that he was not outside
with the youth and staff on 4/29/24. He denied that Youth A
stated anything to him about being threatened. He stated he has
never been threatened by Staff 2 and has a good relationship with
the staff.
Interview held with Staff 3. She reported working for the agency
for 1 year and confirmed that she was working on 4/29/24. She
stated she was the assigned one-to-one staff for Youth A. She
denied hearing Staff 2 threaten Youth A. She also denied Youth A
told her that he was threatened by staff. She lastly denied that
she has ever heard Staff 2 threaten any youth and stated he is
known to have patience with the youth.
Interview held with Youth C. He confirmed that he was outside on
4/29/24 with the other youth and staff. He recalled that they were
playing basketball. He identified Youth A as a more challenging
youth and stated sometimes Youth A has to play by himself, away
3

from other youth. He denied hearing Staff 2 threaten Youth A and
stated he has never heard Staff 2 threaten any youth.
Interview held with Youth A. He refused to come downstairs to
the conference room to be interviewed. An attempt was made to
interview Youth A in the comfort of his bedroom. He initially
refused to be interviewed, but later agreed to answer “only two”
questions. Youth A reported he was outside, and Staff 2
threatened to slap him because he was talking back. When asked
if other youth were outside when this occurred, he refused to
answer. Youth A then stated he was done talking and answering
questions.
Interview held with Youth D. He denied hearing Staff 2 threaten
Youth A while outside on 4/29/24. However, reported that he has
heard Staff 2 threaten Youth A before while upstairs. He was
unable to provide a date or time frame but stated Staff 2 told
Youth A “you’re gonna catch one of these” and “I’m gonna beat
your ass”. Youth D further reported that a staff has bit him before
and he talked with DHHS staff and law enforcement about it.
These allegations were investigated as a part of
SI#2024SIC0001319.
Interview held with Youth E. He denied that Youth A told him he
was threatened by any staff. He confirmed he was outside on
4/29/24 and denied hearing Staff 2 threaten any youth. He
recalled it was mostly Youth A “doing everything” and not
listening. He stated Staff 2 is a good staff. He also stated he has
seen a resident hit Staff 2 in the face before and all he did was go
outside to calm down and get some air.
Interview held with Youth F. He reported being “right there”
outside with the youth and staff on 4/29/24. He recalled that
Youth A was “acting up” and Staff 2 just told him to stop. He
denied he heard Staff 2 threaten Youth A or any other youth in the
program.
Documents Reviewed:
Employee File: File of Staff 2 was reviewed. Employee was hired
2/13/2020. He is current on training and CPI training expires
9/05/2024. Discipline included a verbal warning in 2023 for
violation of treatment services and verbal warnings for attendance
in September and November of 2020.
Christ Child House One on One Staffing Sheet – Documented that
on 4/29/24 during 2nd shift Staff 3 was the one-to-one staff for
4

Youth A. The log reflected the youth was outside during early
afternoon shift and behaviors of Youth A were “poor, defiant, and
fair” during the afternoon shift.
Christ Child House Treatment Standards and Expectations Policy
– Policy documents physical or corporal punishment is prohibited
with the children in any situation. The following techniques are
prohibited: Verbal abuse, threats or derogatory remarks.
Analysis The agency was found to be in compliance with the licensing rule.
Interviews of both youth and staff were completed and there was
not sufficient evidence to support a violation of the licensing rules.
Although the youth reported a threat was made by Staff 1, several
other staff and youth reported being outside at the time and not
hearing any threats being made toward Youth A or any other
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
